title: Voter tool translations - AIM
description: Voter-toolsは、コミュニティが作成したツールで、英語のみです。このツールを他の言語に翻訳するためのリソースが必要です。

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like a great proposal be people already involved on Catalyst voter tool software to do incorporate automatic translation as a relatively low cost. Obviously the biggest question here is will the translations be good enough to be useful on what can be quite technical topics.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is already heavily involved and have a simple plan to translate the app manually and run the proposals themselves through auto translators. One potential issue I can see is we already jumped from ~360 proposal in Fund 5 to ~800 in fund 6. As the auto translation cost is character dependent, what growth have they allowed for in the number and length of proposals for future funds, especially given the amount of funding is also due to increase.
f6_assessments.q2: They have  a simple plan progress upon which should be easy to monitor. They have set some metrics on tracking number of users using the translated app. It would be nice to see some goals set on how many users they would see as a success.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and solution are reasonable and within the scope of the challenge.

The voter tool under current conditions only supports the English language and the idea of translating the tool into 6 more languages should reduce the barrier and participation in Catalyst.

The team will monitor the number of users from each language group and publish website access data, which I consider a relevant metric.
I would recommend the definition of a target regarding the number of users using the tool, so that the impact assessment can be more objective.

I would also recommend including the number of tool users in the last Fund so that we can get a clear picture of the number of potential users.
f6_assessments.q1:
The trio responsible for AIM has participated in several projects on Catalyst and made important contributions to the community, such as the AIM tools, elaboration of guidelines and the Community Landing Page. I would only recommend including links to member profiles, I could find links to AIM member profiles in other proposals but there is no such information in this one.

The team defined the delivery of translations in the tool for the governance phase in Fund7.

There is a budget breakdown, the allocation of resources is reasonable except for the amount allocated to the translation, as the amount of words to be translated wasn't informed(no estimares as well). The translations will be available on Github as an open source content.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity in the problem, solution and in their alignment with the challenge.

A reasonable timeline was established (delivery during the Fund7 governance phase). The number of users of the tool will be shared and will allow the evaluation of the results.
The translations will be available on Github as an open source content.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is directly addresses the challenge by providing multilingual versions of a key tool for participation in Catalyst (i.e. the voter-tool). For non-English speakers, having a native language version of the voter-tool could significant accelerate accessibility and speed of voting. This directly addresses the challenge of "motivat[ing] non english speakers to learn and grow Cardano ecosystem". Therefore, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.

I have a strong background to assess this proposal because I am a board member at PeopleCert/LanguageCert, a global language testing company. I also am a speaker of 9 languages.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this proposal is highly experienced, having been involved with various Cardano tools. There is a simple and clear plan to deliver the proposed translations. The budget is modest, but given the simplicity of the task and the experience of the team, it appears to be sufficient to deliver the project. Therefore, I strongly agree that it is likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The outcome of delivering a good translation of the voter-tool into 6 languages is highly measurable. Native speakers of these languages can assess whether the translations are of high quality, and sufficient to use the voter tool. The proposal also includes a plan for tracking usage of the translated voter-tool in each language. I have stated that I agree rather than strongly agree regarding auditability because the proposal does not include a specific mechanism for reviewing / confirming translation quality. It would be beneficial to add this, even if more budget were required.

f6_assessments.q0:
It's a good-value project that will address an immediate need in a quick and straightforward way, so it should be quite impactful.  
I am slightly wary of the reliance on auto- translation, as it can be pretty awful  – but it does make the work faster and cheaper, and arguably as long as it's *mostly* comprehensible, it serves the purpose. And it is good that human translators are being used for the permanent text of the app itself.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team built the voter tool, so they clearly have the skills to manage the translation.
The project timeline looks workable, and the budget is clear, although perhaps a little low in some areas (e.g. will the project management budget be enough to include managing marketing and publicity?)
But there's no mention of risk – it's hard to completely assess feasibility without knowing how the team would mitigate the obvious risks.(For example – what if users find the auto translations incomprehensible or misleading? Or what if the translations are not sufficiently promoted – in the target languages and countries, ofc – and uptake is too low? I note there's no specific mention of budget for creating publicity in the target languages – and this could be important, given that it will need to reach those who probably don't engage that much with existing Catalyst channels specifically *because* of the language barrier that this proposal seeks to address.)
f6_assessments.q2: It's great that the translations will be available on GitHub. And tracking user numbers is a good start.  But given the reliance on auto-translation, I think the project needs to  find a way to additionally record if users were happy with and could understand the translated material or if it was accurate - even if it's just a survery of a sample of users, or even checking a sample of the translations with human translators. Without that, it would be hard to audit whether the project had succeeded.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal perfectly meets the objectives of the challenge, because it intends to translate the electoral tool into 6 languages, and thus facilitate one of the most important activities of the Catalyst Project for those who do not speak English as a first language. It's a simple but accurate one that will certainly benefit the community and also relates to the "Catalyst Value on Boarding" challenge as it will encourage more community members to participate in its actions.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is certainly strong and capable of executing the proposal, as they are very active people in the community, that is, they understand a lot about the Cardano ecosystem and especially about the Catalyst Project. This can be proven by the fact that they have already developed other tools, like ca-tool, which I personally use and I've seen other cas commenting how important it is for their work. In this way, you are sure that they will be able to successfully develop this project further.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding auditability, we have a complete understanding of what will happen, how and through what order. The proposal is very simple; an automatic translation followed by a human will be used to improve. And you will also need someone to manage the project. The financial divisions are satisfactorily cleared, I personally found the money asked to be very fair and possible. In terms of success metrics, I believe the community will be able to track through the adoption of translations, but it would be positive if any of the authors could counter that amount to give feedback to the community. It would also be nice if the githup repository were also attached, so we know where to go if this proposal were funded!

solution: 投票ツールをスペイン語、日本語、フランス語、ロシア語、中国語、ポルトガル語の6カ国語に翻訳し、提供します。
experience: AIMのメンバーは、voter-tool、CA-tool、vCA-Tool、Community Landing Pageを支えるチームです。開発者、デザイナー、そしてデータの専門家です。
